intro: Thlaspi pygmaeum, commonly known as the dwarf cabbages, is a small, flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, featuring dense, woolly leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in areas with low temperatures and high sunlight exposure. Thlaspi pygmaeum is an important plant for pollinators and is adapted to survive in harsh, cold environments.
